docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 18--A high official at the American Mission to the United Nations charged today that Chile had voted for a draft resolution linking Zionism with racism last night to buy Arab support against charges that Chilean authorities...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 18--A high official at the American Mission to the United Nations charged today that Chile had voted for a draft resolution linking Zionism with racism last night to buy Arab support against charges that Chilean authorities were responsible for torture and other violations of human rights.
docs.abstract: High official at Amer Mission to UN on Oct 12 charges that Chile voted for draft resolution linking Zionism with racism to buy Arab support against charges that Chilean authorities were responsible for torture and other violations (S)

headline.main: U.S. Aide Charges Chile Sold U.N. Vote to Arabs; CHILE 'SOLD' VOTE, U.S. AIDE CHARGES

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Oct. 25 (AP)--The Inter-American Press Association says the press possesses "the moral strength and unwavering determination to defend America from the totalitarian forces which everywhere are baring their ugly claws."
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Oct. 25 (AP)--The Inter-American Press Association says the press possesses "the moral strength and unwavering determination to defend America from the totalitarian forces which everywhere are baring their ugly claws."
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Press Assn pledges to resist totalitarianism; adopts rept by com on press freedom that says 27 hemisphere nations enjoy free press, 10 do not (S)

docs.snippet: FAMAILLA, Argentina The Argentine Army, which has not fought a war for nearly 100 years, is engaged in close combat with a guerrilla force operating in the mountains that overlook this sugarcane growing region.
docs.lead_paragraph: FAMAILLA, Argentina The Argentine Army, which has not fought a war for nearly 100 years, is engaged in close combat with a guerrilla force operating in the mountains that overlook this sugarcane growing region.
docs.abstract: article on Argentine Army battle with guerrilla force of about 200 men notes guerrillas are organized and supported by People's Revolutionary Army, whose chief is Mario Roberto Santucho, Cuban-trained; says guerrillas are not from Tucuman, but are recruited, trained and reptdly sent to Tucuman from Buenos Aires, Rosario and Cordoba; notes documents seized in guerrilla camps reptdly show that People's Revolutionary Army intends to establish 'liberated zone' in Tucuman to serve as base to extend guerrilla activities throughout northern Argentina to attract international support; says mil forces appear to be winning fight against guerrillas; map (M)

headline.main: Guerrillas in Argentina Battle Army in a War Without Prisoners

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 21 A few days ago a New York businessman named Edward Kline telephoned Moscow and talked with Andrei D. Sakharov, the Soviet physicist and Nobel Prize winner, about the forthcoming trial of another Soviet scientist and political dissenter, Andrei Tverdokhlebov.
docs.abstract: article on major orgns concerned with plight of pol prisoners; they include Amnesty Internatl, IRC, Ford Foundation, Internatl League for Rights of Man, Internatl Comm of Jurists and PEN; Jacques Moreillon of IRC, David Heaps of Ford Foundation and Mrs Betty Fussier of league comment (L)

docs.snippet: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 23 (AP) Vijay Amritraj of India delighted his countrymen today by defeating the United States Open champion, Manuel Orantes of Spain, 7-5, 6-3, for the men's singles title in the $50,000 Indian Grand Prix lawn tennis...
docs.lead_paragraph: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 23 (AP) Vijay Amritraj of India delighted his countrymen today by defeating the United States Open champion, Manuel Orantes of Spain, 7-5, 6-3, for the men's singles title in the $50,000 Indian Grand Prix lawn tennis championships.
docs.abstract: Vijay Amritraj (India) defeats Manuel Orantes (Spain) in Indian Grand Prix lawn tennis champ on Nov 23, Calcutta, India; Orantes and Juan Gisbert beat Amritraj and his brother Anand in doubles final (S)

headline.main: V. Amritraj Beats Orantes in Final

docs.snippet: A bitterness 30 years old welled up in Paris yesterday when the election of Felicien Marceau, playwright and novelist, to the 40-member French Academy prompted the resignation from it of Pierre Emmanuel, a poet and editor. He said the choice of Mr....
docs.lead_paragraph: A bitterness 30 years old welled up in Paris yesterday when the election of Felicien Marceau, playwright and novelist, to the 40-member French Academy prompted the resignation from it of Pierre Emmanuel, a poet and editor. He said the choice of Mr. Marceau was "incompatible with the national honor."
docs.abstract: W Ger Foreign Min Hans-Dietrich Genscher arrives in Jerusalem on Nov 27 and for 1st time there are no protest demonstrations on W Ger leader's visit; recalls 'gruesome past' in arrival speech; says he has come with 'great expectation and great emotion'; Israeli Foreign Min Yigal Allon tells Genscher that he is among friends (S)

headline.main: Notes on People; Election Splits French Academy
